conversations.content: Graaawwwrrr!
Rwaaaaghhh!
Aw, crap! We gotta do somethin', and fast! Those fiends have that lady surrounded!
Hyaaaah!
Huh. Looks like she's got it under control.
*pant* *pant* That...was terrifying...
Are you all right?
Gaaah! S-scared? Who said I was scared? I wasn't scared!
Uh, I mean...pardon me, but you are...?
Ranzal. This is Euden.
Hold on—the man who lives in the castle? PRINCE Euden?
One and the same. May I ask your name?
Oh, where are my manners? I am Julietta, a Paladyn.
My Paladyn father bade me find you and join your cause. If you'll have me, of course.
Absolutely! We could definitely use someone of your skill.
...Is that it? No tears of joy? No falling to your knees in thanks that such a powerful Paladyn would align herself to—
Graaaaggghhhhh!
Aaaahhhh! D-did you hear that?!
More fiends. Looks like ya missed a few.
But yer strong enough on yer own, so ya probably don't need our help takin' 'em down. We'll just be goin', then.
H-hold on just a moment! I...I can't leave you to fend for yourselves! Allow me to see you safely through the—
Aw, don't worry about us; we can take  care of ourselves.
I said wait! I b-bet you're just acting tough, when in fact you're as helpless as a newborn babe! I'll accompany you—
Really, we'll be all right. We need you to take care of the fiends here more than we need a bodyguard. Until we meet again—
WAAAAAIT!
Gaaah! Y-you'll pull my arm out of its socket if... Huh? Why are you crying?
I'm not *sniff* crying. *sniff*
But there are tears streaming down your face...
Just...just stay here and fight by my side!
Um, all right. But let's do it quickly so we can catch up to Ranzal.
You...you mean it? Oh, thank the goddess...
I...I mean, just try not to get in my way!
Julietta, do you have a moment? I wish to ask you something.
Elly! I...I mean, Elisanne! Of course. What is it?
Have we met somewhere prior to your arrival at the castle? Your name has such a familiar ring to it.
Well, that much is understandable. We are both Paladyns, after all.
Oh—that's it! You are the one who turned heads making the Paladyn trial look like morning warm-ups. You have a bright future ahead of you.
A bright future! Er, I mean...h-honestly, that ＂trial＂ is hardly difficult enough to merit the name.
Besides, such tests with the Paladyns matter not. I will demonstrate my worth more directly.
Well, I'm glad that we can now count a knight of your caliber among our allies.
Hmph! Has it taken you this long to realize my ＂caliber＂?! Now, if that will be all, I have other things to tend to!
She takes it for granted that she should prove herself directly rather than rely on her past reputation. I foresee a bright future ahead of her.
I can't believe Elly actually knows who I am!
I finally spoke with my hero face-to-face...
But why...why did I say those things?!
She must despise me now... Oh, Goddess, my stomach hurts...
Um...
Gaaaah! Y-Your Highness?! How long have you been there?!
Since you and Elisanne started talking. Sorry, I really didn't mean to eavesdrop.
I—you—whatever you think you heard, you are mistaken! I don't admire Elisanne, or any such—
Admire?
What?! I... Oh... F-fine! I admit it! I admire her!
In the past, there was a time when something weighed greatly on my heart, and Elly... She saved me.
I admire her greatly and was ecstatic when she came to talk to me...
Yet I acted like such a haughty fool... *sigh* It's laughable, isn't it?
I'm not laughing.
W-well, maybe not outwardly, but I'm sure on the inside you're in stitches...
And I'm sure I'm not.
To me, it seemed Elisanne was truly impressed with your skills as a Paladyn.
I don't think you need to be worried about her hating you or anything like that.
I... *sob* I just... Thank you, Prince Euden...
What? Why are you crying?! What did I say?!
N-nothing... *sniff* I'm just... *sob* Just so relieved!
Was that the last of the fiends? They certainly didn't put up much of a fight.
Nicely done as always! Our battles've been a breeze since ya showed up.
Indeed. Hardly anyone has gotten injured since you joined us, either.
Hmph. Such compliments ring hollow with foes so feeble.
Now that the battle is won, I'm going back to the castle to clean off all this blood.
Elly— I mean, Elisanne! What is it?
That was a splendid fight, Julietta.
I hope you will fight by our side for a long while. That...that is all I wished to say.
You... You needn't have wasted your breath. That has always been my intention. Now, if you'll excuse me...
Huh? She looks pale...
Owwww, ow ow ow...
Julietta? What's wrong? Are you injured?
Prince Euden... Why are you here...? Owww...
Your face told me something might be wrong. If you're hurt, I can get Cleo to come and heal you—
W-wait! Don't call anyone over! It...it's only a stomachache...
Are you sure?
I'll be all right... Stress always wreaks  havoc on my stomach...
I'm sorry to hear that... What is it that's causing you stress?
Everything! People's expectations, fighting fiends—all of it! I feel so scared and helpless, all I want to do is cry.
Whenever someone invests any sort of faith in me, I can't help but think...what if?
What if I fail next time? What if I disappoint them?
Please, Prince Euden... Please don't tell anyone...
If you don't want me to, I'll respect that... But wouldn't it help you if everyone knew?
Perhaps, but I will never know. Divulging that truth may shatter everyone's faith in me—and the fear of that is paralyzing.
It's a secret I've kept since I was a child, because I was born into a prestigious family of Paladyns.
But the Julietta everyone looks up to? I am leagues away from her.
I never want to be a source of disappointment, so I always put on a brave face. Despite the pain it brings my stomach... Ow!
Julietta?! You should rest—
D-don't coddle me! This pain is noth— Owwwwwwwie!
Very well. I promise I won't say anything to the others. Just tell me you'll rest a little before we return.
*pant* I fear we may have overextended ourselves... There are just too many fiends!
Don't tell me you're yielding already, Elisanne!
You're right, Julietta. We have not lost yet. Let us rally and... Oh no.
Another pack of fiends is closing in! We cannot let them join forces!
My legs are already weak with fear...
But I must help Elly!
Leave them to me, Elisanne!
What are you talking— Hey! Julietta! Where are you going?
I can handle that pack on my own! I'll draw them away from you!
Wait! Not even you are strong enough to handle that many on your own!
If you're so worried, dispatch those other fiends quickly and come help me!
Though there may not be much left for you to do by then!
Graaaggghhh!
If you want a shot at Elly, you have to go through me first!
*pant* *pant* Good... We made it... I think we've defeated all the fiends in this area!
Only the pack Julietta took on remains! We must hurry, Euden!
Hngh... I hope...everyone is okay... I need to finish these fiends, fast...
Gah! My leg!
Raaawwggghh!
Ah—
Julietta! Are you all right?!
Thank the goddess we made it in time.
Elly... Prince Euden...
*sniff* I... I... ELLLLY! *sob*
Julietta?!
I w-was so s-scared! *sob*
Seeing Julietta cry like this is...unexpected.
Ya can say that again. She always seems so tough, ya know?
*hiccup* *sob*
Um... What do I... Er, Julietta? You...you did great!
You saved us all! Um... I-it's okay now, I'm here...
All right, everyone! We'll be heading out to hunt down fiends again this afternoon, so make sure you're prepared.
Ugh... Again...?
It's all right, Julietta. You can stay in the castle if you're scared.
Wh-who said I was scared?! I mean... I am, but just a tiny bit!
S-still, you can't just leave me here... It makes me feel so...so useless...
What happened to the girl what never even blinked before chargin' into danger?
She broke down in sobs before her peers, that's what.
One doesn't recover from that.
I still can't wrap my head around it. How can someone as strong as you actually be scared'a fiends?
To think you harbored such fear and still drew that pack of fiends away by yourself...
That surprised even me. But I could think only of protecting Elly...
And yet, in the end, I only managed to break down and cause more trouble.
Nonsense. Fighting so hard to protect us,  despite being scared, was incredibly brave.
His Highness is right. And besides, everyone is scared of battling fiends.
What? Even you, Elly?
＂Elly＂? That is not... Ahem. Yes. Even me.
And me. There hasn't been a single battle I've fought where fear hasn't played a part.
If anything, it seems you both act more recklessly the more frightened you are.
I... Uh, well, that's because sometimes you have to act in spite of your fear. Right, Julietta?
R-right... Certainly!
Honestly... I wish you would at least give some thought to the trouble your actions cause those who have to watch your back.
Ha ha! I do, I swear!
Um... Prince Euden?
I know I've caused you all enormous trouble, but...please don't make me leave the castle.
I wouldn't dream of it. You're welcome here as long as you wish to stay.
Julietta, I know I said before that your future as a Paladyn was promising... But I was mistaken.
You are already an excellent Paladyn. I am glad to have you fighting by my side.
W-well... Of course you are! If anything, you all ought to be begging me to stay—
I...I mean... Oh, Goddess...
Ha ha! Old habits die hard, I suppose.
